elements.title: spreads
elements.contents: ... that in countries like the United States, prisoners supplement inadequate prison food by combining ingredients like instant ramen (pictured), mayonnaise and Kool-Aid into improvised meals called "spreads"?

elements.title: Royal Hibernian Hotel
elements.contents: ... that the Royal Hibernian Hotel is thought to be the oldest hotel in Ireland?

elements.title: Pierre Olaf
elements.contents: ... that Pierre Olaf's portrayal of Jacquot in the 1961 Broadway musical Carnival! earned him a nomination for the Tony Award for Best Featured Actor in a Musical in 1962?

elements.title: Burnt Candlemas
elements.contents: ... that an English army devastated Lothian in Scotland so thoroughly in 1356 that the episode became known as Burnt Candlemas?

elements.title: Bernette Ford
elements.contents: ... that Bernette Ford was one of the first members of the Black Creators for Children, an organization that helped promote black authors and increase diversity in children's books?

elements.title: The Greenwood Encyclopedia of Science Fiction and Fantasy
elements.contents: ... that The Greenwood Encyclopedia of Science Fiction and Fantasy contains an idiosyncratic selection of topics, from "Aliens in Space" to "Rats and Mice"?

elements.title: James Rorke
elements.contents: ... that Natal frontier trader James Rorke specified that he be buried under three feet (0.9 m) of concrete because he feared Zulu graverobbers?

elements.title: Skitchin'
elements.contents: ... that the graffiti artists hired for the video game Skitchin' were interviewed at a train station because they were too young to drive?
